definition: first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: But the justifiability of medical treatment has been limit in strict condition.
sentences.chinese: 但醫療行爲的正當性具有嚴格的條件限制。

sentences.english: Chapter two discusses the justifiability of Antimonopoly regulatory law for abuse of IPRs.
sentences.chinese: 第二章提出反壟斷法規制知識產權濫用的正當性命題。

sentences.english: This article mainly discusses the justice of comparison between the political thoughts of China and the West.
sentences.chinese: 該文主要探討了中西政治思想比較的正當性問題。

sentences.english: This article is divided into three parts to study the legitimacy of government right to the tax preference.
sentences.chinese: 本文分爲三個部分來研究政府稅收優惠權的正當性。

sentences.english: One very important and influential idea of legitimacy is connected with democratic procedures.
sentences.chinese: 正當性的民主程序是四種觀念中最具影響力的。

sentences.english: The properness and fairness of consumption is its reflection.
sentences.chinese: 消費的正當性和公正性是其具體體現。

sentences.english: Third, it has the legal admissibility nature, demonstrated its presence in the legal legitimacy.
sentences.chinese: 三是它具有法律許容性，論證了其在法律上的正當性。

sentences.english: In addition, forgiveness has the limitation of justifiability.

definition: principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
